meanings.definition: A person who is employed to work during the day.
meanings.sent1: The dayworker arrived early in the morning to start their shift.
meanings.sent2: The company hired a dayworker to help with the busy daytime schedule.
meanings.sent3: The dayworker joked that they were like a sunflower, always working when the sun is up.
meanings.sent4: The dayworker was a ray of sunshine in the office, bringing positivity to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The image of the dayworker diligently working under the bright daylight stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: A temporary worker hired for a specific period of time during the day.
meanings.sent1: The dayworker assisted with the project until the afternoon.
meanings.sent2: They needed a dayworker to cover the morning shift at the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The dayworker felt like a time traveler, working only when the sun was high.
meanings.sent4: The dayworker's impact was like a burst of energy in the middle of the day.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the dayworker diligently completing tasks under the daylight was inspiring.
